intro: Hymenocoleus neurodictyon var. rhombicifolius, commonly known as the rhombic-leafed hymenocoleus, is a rare and specialized member of the Podostemaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, rhombic-shaped leaves that are often submerged in aquatic environments. The plant exhibits a creeping growth habit with roots that anchor it to rocky substrates in fast-flowing streams. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in clusters of two to four. The species is notable for its morphological adaptations to its specialized habitat, making it an interesting subject for botanical study.
